resources.string:
1.	Click the Z home button to raise the bed into the printing position.

2.	Once the bed has been raised, position the printer head over the back right wing nut.

3.	Use the test sheet that came with the printer and place it between the nozzle and the platform.

4.	Turn the wing nut until the nozzle is just touching the test sheet. The test sheet should just be able to slide out.

 5.	Move the print head over to the back left wing nut and then the front wing nut and repeat steps 3 and 4.

Heat the extruder up to 240c and push through some filament, this may un-clog the nozzle.

While the extruder is at temperature for the filament which you are using, take a length of filament and load it into the extruder.

Push the filament through the extruder so that it starts coming out of the nozzle (it might not if you have a full clog)

 Cool the nozzle down to around 100c and keep pushing the filment through until no more will come out of the nozzle.

 Once the nozzle has cooled to this temperature try to pull the filament out of the extruder. If the filament doesn not pull out without snapping, heat the extruder up to printing temperature and keep pulling the filament until it pops out of the extruder.

You should see some black bits and dirt on the end of the filament. Cut off the end and repeat until the filament is clean.

1.	Use the supplied allen key to remove the 2 screws at the front of the fan. Be careful when removing them not to loose any of the parts.

2.	Use the long, thin allen key to unscrew the small black grub screw facing the front of the printer. Try not to remove the grub screw completely to avoid losing it.

3.	To remove the whole print head from the carriage unscrew the screws underneath the carriage using the supplied allen key.

PLA nozzle 190-210c	PLA bed: 60-70c

ABS nozzle:240c	ABS bed: 110c

PA(Nylon) nozzle: 240-260c 	PA(Nylon) bed: 80-100c

PC+ nozzle: 240-260c	PC+bed: 110-120c

1.	 Remove the filament spool from its packaging. Keep hold of the silica get as it can be useful for filament storage.

2.	 Mount the filament spool onto the spool holder so that the filament rotates in a counter clockwise direction.

3.	 Gently pull the filament from the spool. Cut the filament flat for easy installation.

4.	 Insert the filament into the tube until it comes out of the other end of the tube.

5.	 Push down on the printer head arm and insert the filament into the hole at the top of the printer head. Push the filament until it reaches the end of the nozzle, then release the printer head arm.

Please note: when changing filament from a hotter melting point to a lower one, use the hotter melting point to flush out the old filament.

To print a custom file, you will need a 3D design in either .stl or .obj file format. You can download these files from websites such as www.MyMiniFactory.com or design your own using CAD or other 3D design software.

To load the file into Repetier Host click the load button located in the top left. Navigate through your files to find the correct .stl or .obj file and click open to load the file.

Multiple files can be loaded onto the build plate at once.

For you .stl or .obj file to be ready for 3D printing it needs to be "sliced" first. Slicing converts the design file into individual layers and each layer has a set of commands to tell the 3D printer what to do.

To slice a file, first make sure that you have the correct settings for the printer you are using. These settings can vary depending on the printer model, quality and printing temperatures.

Once you have checked the slicing settings click the slice button and a progress bar will appear.

When the slicing has finished you can either print the file on a connected printer or save the newly created gcode file so it can be printing using an SD card or saved for later.

Please note: If you are using a printer without a heated bed use only Slic3r and not CuraEngine.

Export: If you have loaded multiple files into the software you can use this button tp export them out as one file. 

Add Object: This has the same function as the load button.

Copy Object(s): If you wish to copy an object without loading it in multiple times you can click this button and select the number of copies.

Auto-Position: This will automatically position the selected object in the centre of the build plate.

Centre Object Centres the selected object relative to the size of the bed.

Scale Object: This will increase or decrease the size in any or the entire xyz axis. To scale uniformly (in all axis) keep the padlock locked and enter a value into the X axis box. To scale non-uniformly unlock the padlock and you will be able to enter individual values for all axis.

Rotate Object: A value can be entered into one of the xyz axis to rotate in the chosen axis by that value, from 0-360 degrees.
